intro: Doronicum austriacum f. monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed Austrian leopard's bane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically features a single terminal flower head, distinguishing it from the typical form of the species. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges at higher elevations.
